episode_summary: This episode features facts about a doctor in India prescribing Charlie Chaplin DVDs for mood disorders, the confusion over the reading order of the Chronicles of Narnia, a Jack Russell Terrier that traveled to both poles, and the inspiration behind the character of Don Corleone in The Godfather.

facts.fact: A doctor in India, Ashok Aswani, would prescribe DVDs of Charlie Chaplin to his patients to convince them that joy and laughter was the remedy to their malady.
No one really knows what order the Chronicles of Narnia should be read in, not even C.S. Lewis knew.
The only dog to have been to both the North and South Poles was not a husky nor any kind of adventure dog, but a small Jack Russell terrier.
The character of Don Corleone in the novel The Godfather was based on the author's mother.
